page.title: 15HAILEY AREA -- EMPLOYMENT
page.content: {SQUARES 3611 and 3610 {EMPLOYMENT}is at the Lea Valley Exp. Horticultural Station, the Galley Hall Public Ho. & Hailey Farm. Crops grown in this area of intensive glasshouse cultivation are mushrooms, Pelargonium Zonale, pot & bedding plants, peppers, cucumbers, & various vegetables. {FARMING}occurs mainly at Hailey Farm. All the farm is grass/pasture with an approx. price per acre of Â£2500. The farmer has increased the number of cows from 35 to 110 even though dairy farming is in decline due to EEC imports and mechanised methods. Crops no longer grown are barley, wheat and oil seed rape. Chardingleve Farm is not used for production but merely as private pasture for horses. Hailey Manor{SCHOOL,}founded 37 yrs. ago, has about 50 local boys aged 11 to 16 and is the only school.
